biolockj.module.report

Class CompileOtuCounts

  • java.lang.Object
    • biolockj.module.BioModuleImpl
      • biolockj.module.ScriptModuleImpl
        • biolockj.module.JavaModuleImpl
          • biolockj.module.report.otu.CompileOtuCounts
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BioModule, JavaModule, ScriptModule

    public class CompileOtuCounts
extends JavaModuleImpl
implements JavaModule
    This BioModule compiles the counts from all OTU count files into a single summary OTU count file containing OTU counts for the entire dataset.

      • isValidInputModule

        public boolean isValidInputModule(BioModule previousModule)
                           throws Exception
        Description copied from class: BioModuleImpl
        In the early stages of the pipeline, starting with the very 1st module ImportMetadata, most modules expect sequence files as input. This method returns false if the previousModule only produced a new metadata file, such as ImportMetadata or RegisterNumReads. When BioModuleImpl.initInputFiles() is called, this method determines if the previousModule output is valid input for the current BioModule. The default implementation of this method returns FALSE if the previousModule only generates a new metadata file.
        Specified by:
        isValidInputModule in interface BioModule
        Overrides:
        isValidInputModule in class BioModuleImpl
        Parameters:
        previousModule - BioModule that ran before the current BioModule
        Returns:
        boolean TRUE if the previousModule output is acceptable input for the current BioModule
        Throws:
        Exception - if unexpected errors occur
